title: As rent control gains momentum, Wu shows skepticism of blanket statewide cap
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Statewide rent control will likely to be on the ballot next fall, supporters say.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu wishes they were not backing a one-size-fits-all approach.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu attended a City Council meeting in 2023 where councilors approved her rent control proposal.

title: 2025 holiday movies: 100 new Christmas films to watch this season
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Streaming All of the best 2025 Christmas movies on Netflix, Lifetime, Hallmark Channel, and more.
2025 holiday movies: Mark Wahlberg, Michelle Monaghan and Zoe Colletti in "The Family Plan 2," streaming November 21, 2025 on Apple TV.
Apple TV By Kevin Slane November 19, 2025 | 2:01 PM 6 minutes to read The holiday movie season is upon us.

title: Is Massachusetts doing enough to regulate online sports betting?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Amid scandals in pro sports and rising public health concerns, should Massachusetts reconsider how tightly it regulates online betting and prop wagers?
A DraftKings employee in the lobby of their Back Bay offices.

(Lane Turner/Globe Staff) By Annie Jonas November 19, 2025 | 1:43 PM 2 minutes to read A string of high-profile scandals has put online sports betting under intense scrutiny, sparking debate about whether the industry’s rapid growth is outpacing the state’s ability to regulate it — and whether prop bets are creating new public health risks.

title: Foxwoods restaurant temporarily closed after Tuesday night fire
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News Three firefighters were evaluated at a local hospital.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Three firefighters were taken to a hospital after battling a fire at Foxwoods Resort and Casino Tuesday night.

title: South Station fare gates are scheduled to go live in December. Here’s what to know.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Transportation The fare gates have been in use at North Station since 2022.
MBTA Commuter rail passengers going through the electronic fare gates at North Station in 2023.
Jonathan Wiggs/The Boston Globe Three years after North Station, South Station is set to get fare gates in December.

title: Seaport biotech lays off most of its employees amid sale talks
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Sensei Biotherapeutics is reducing its workforce by 65% as it evaluates strategic options in a weak fundraising environment.
A view of the Seaport area on September 24, 2025 that show the Childrens Museum, Moakley Federal Courthouse, Boston Tea Party Museum.

(David L Ryan/ Boston Globe Staff) Sensei Biotherapeutics, a cancer-focused biotech with offices in the Seaport, announced this week it will shed about 65% of its staff while evaluating a potential sale.

title: Reflections from Vince Wilfork, Isaiah Thomas and the rest of 2025 ‘Tradition’ honorees

bullets: Boston Bruins "It feels like I won multiple championships and I was only here for two-and-a-half, three years.

title: Jaylen Brown, Joe Mazzulla explain Brown’s first-half benching
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "The team kind of feeds off me, I know that, so I gotta be better.
Joe [Mazzulla] is just holding me to a higher standard.

" Joe Mazzulla talking to Jaylen Brown during preseason on October 15 (Charles Krupa/AP) The Celtics improved to 8-7 after a 113-99 victory over the Brooklyn Nets Tuesday night, the first time they’ve been above .

title: A Vermont mountain breaks a snow record, a NH one says it’s close
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Skiing One resort is opening a week early due to abundant snow, calling this month "a November to Remember.
" Mount Mansfield Peak in Stowe, Vermont in 2017.
File By Kristi Palma November 19, 2025 | 11:46 AM 1 minute to read New England ski mountains are rejoicing over recent snow and some are even breaking records.
